title: Home
text:
Welcome
This is a non-denominational Christian Bible study. The author uses the New International Version (NIV) or New King James Version (NKJV) when developing these studies. If you do not have a NIV or NKJV Bible, you can find one online:
Bible Gateway
Bible Study Tools


Studies
There are several year-long studies for you to choose. Each study has a topic for every month of the year. There are Bible verses for each week of the month.
Even though these studies were written in years past, do not hesitate to (re)visit them as often as you feel led to do so.

Study 1


Study 2



Tips

Pray and seek wisdom and understanding from the Holy Spirit.
Read the Bible verse for the week multiple times to gain meaning and context.
Journal your thoughts for reflection later.


May God be glorified in your life!



Photo by Aaron Burden on Unsplash

title: 01 | Fresh Anointing & Blocking Out Fear
text:
January marks a new year on the calendar. Most people think you have to have a “resolution” for the New Year. Some resolutions are hopeful, some are made out of fear. In Christ, anytime can be a new year! Ask Him for a fresh anointing for wisdom and courage to face any New Year in your life.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Isaiah 41:10

Week 2

Deuteronomy 1:21

Week 3

2 Timothy 1:7

Week 4

Isaiah 35:4

title: 02 | Love
text:
Love is celebrated in February. This custom brings joy to some and sorrow to others. Remember GOD’s love for us has no beginning and no end. His word tells us: “Love covers a multitude of sin.” Let’s celebrate GOD’s love for us!
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

1 Psalms 117

Week 2

2 John 16:27

Week 3

3 Proverbs 10:12

Week 4

1 John 4: 7-8

title: 03 | Wind
text:
Wind is unseen but felt. Wind can cause blizzards, hurricanes or tornadoes. It can also bring relief on a hot summer day. Wind provides a wonderful way for sails on a boat to move or a balloon to take you up into the sky. Life can be like the wind: bitter and sweet. Trust GOD no matter where the wind takes you.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Hosea 8:7

Week 2

John 3:8

Week 3

Psalms 55:8

Week 4

Matt. 7:25

Week 5

Mark 4:39

title: 04 | New Growth
text:
Spring issues in a season of new growth and warmth after a cold winter. The cold allows us time to stay indoors: listen to the Holy Spirit, develop new ideas and begin the process for new growth. New growth can occur in many ways. It can occur by changing habits, learning a new skill, teaching a bible study, or taking a class and other things. Seek GOD and ask Him for ways to produce new growth in you.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Ephesians 4:15

Week 2

Isaiah 43:19

Week 3

Colossians 1:6

Week 4

title: 05 | Mercy & Stillness
text:
The word of GOD tells us that GOD’s mercy never ends. I’ve found that most of us appreciate this when it applies to us. But, we dislike this when it comes to those that have hurt us. GOD commands us to love one another as He loves us. A part of loving someone is to extend mercy in situations where it’s needed, even when it’s not requested. Thank you, Lord, for mercy: May we extend it to others as you do (have) to us.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

1 Chronicles 21:13

Week 2

Luke 1:50

Week 3

Psalms 23:6

Week 4

Ephesians 2:4

title: 06 | Waves
text:
At times, it seems like our lives move in waves. Waves of hope, sorrow, fear, joy and peace. No matter which waves we’re riding, GOD is present. During our seasons of riding whichever wave life gives us we must remember to keep our eyes on the Lord. He can and will keep us in his care in/on the waves of life.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Job 38:1 and 11

Week 2

Psalms 65:7

Week 3

Psalms 107:29 and 29:7

Week 4

Matt 8:27

title: 07 | Freedom & Liberty
text:
Freedom is a word that invokes many emotions, depending on your circumstances. We should all strive to have freedom from fear, harmful thoughts and worry. Christ’s death on the cross guarantees us freedom from all of these things and more.
Once we accept Jesus as our savior, we are saved and free. True freedom comes from walking with him. My hope is that we tap into the freedom that only Jesus gives!
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Galatians 5:1

Week 2

Psalms 119:45

Week 3

Ephesians 3:12

Week 4

Isaiah 61:1

Week 5

Romans 8:2

title: 08 | Peace
text:
Peace is precious and cannot be bought. We as a society look for peace in things and places. These places and things include bars, gyms, cars, food and, hopefully, church. True peace can only be found in Jesus Christ! His word tells us to seek Him and He will give us peace in every area of our lives. May we seek and obtain the peace that only GOD gives.

Week 1

Week 2

Week 3

Week 4

Week 5

title: 09 | Changes
text:
Fall is a season that often appears to have the most drastic physical changes. The leaves on trees turn beautiful colors and then fall to the ground. We gather and dispose of them. This could also be a time to make changes in our attitude and outlook. Letting some things “fall away” or change. GOD wants us to “fall” into His word and allow it to visibly and spiritually change us.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Week 2

Psalms 102:26

Week 3

Week 4

title: 10 | Forgiveness
text:
Forgiveness is a choice and a process. We have to choose to forgive if we want to be forgiven by our heavenly father. When we choose to forgive, the sometimes long process of restoring begins. By the power of the Holy Spirit, we extend the same grace and mercy that has been extended to us. As time moves on, we will find that the hurt and pain that was caused has lessened. Our hearts and minds are free towards the person and with God.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 1

Acts 10:43

Week 2

Psalms 130:4

Week 3

Week 4

Psalms 32:5

title: 11 | Justice
text:
At some point in everyone’s life, we seek justice and provide justice. Justice comes in many forms. It can be simple or complex. Simple justice may look like fixing some you broke. Complex justice can look like fixing something that is broken and restoring all parties involved. GOD’s justice is simple and complex. Complex because he sent His only son to die for our sins. Simple because we just need to receive it.
Meditate on these verses to gain wisdom:

Week 2

Exodus 14:14

Week 3

Week 4

Week 5

title: 12 | Humility
text:
As I reflect on the year and this season, “humility” captures the posture of my heart. I am humbled that the Lord allowed me to see another calendar year. I am awed and amazed by the story of the birth of Christ (never gets old), and the joy in the atmosphere! I am humbled by the willingness of strangers to share with one another. I am so thankful for Jesus who humbled Himself to save us.

Week 2

Week 3

Week 4

title: 01 | Refuge
text:
Refuge is another name for shelter. A shelter is a place we go to for comfort, to feel protected from storms and safe from trouble. CHRIST is our refuge a place of comfort, protection and a safe place for our spirit in trouble!

title: 02 | Redeemed
text:
As we ponder what redeemed means in our faith walk, we may think of different things. Most of us think of our lives or souls. Others may think of time and situations. Whatever way you ponder the word “redeemed,” make sure JESUS is a part of it.

title: 03 | Renew
text:
The prefix “re” means to do again. In life, it is a privledge when we are allowed to redo things. JESUS by His spirit renews us. He makes us new again.

title: 04 | Rest
text:
Rest is essential for good health and mental well being. As scripture tells us, we also need rest for our souls. The LORD tells us to come to Him and De will give us rest. May we seek the rest that only GOD gives!

title: 05 | Eternal
text:
“Eternal” means something that lasts forever. We are encouraged to set our hearts on things eternal. These things include our relationship with CHRIST and following His precepts needed for eternal life. May our thoughts and actions lead us to eternal life.
